author: rhuijben
msg: Resolve two pages of MSB3422 and MSB3425 warnings in the Visual Studio 2005
and 2008 automated builds by adding an explicit project guid to the
zlib template file.
The guid enables MSBuild to provide information on project dependencies.
* generator/zlib.vcproj.ezt: Removed Scc headers that should only be added
if the project is managed by an Scc provider and added an explicit guid.

author: rhuijben
msg: Create a few solution groups in the Visual C++ 2005 and 2008 solutions to
make it easier to find the module I'm working on.
This doesn't change the build, but groups the projects in the Visual Studio
IDE. The groups created are Libraries,
Libraries/Dlls, Libraries/Swig, Libraries/Java, Programs and Tests.
* build/generator/gen_vcnet_vcproj.py
(Generator.write): Calculate the group to place the project in and
provide the group to the ProjectItem constructor for usage by the
template writer.
* build/generator/vc2005_sln.ezt
(Template): Add 6 predefined group projects and add a group placement
block. This block declares in which parent a project should be shown.

author: hwright
msg: Doc updates in followup to r33511.
* subversion/include/svn_wc.h
(svn_wc_add_repos_file2): Re-add @since tag, mark with SVN_DEPRECATED.

author: gstein
msg: Get rid of the remnants of the old "special only" concept. It just makes
it harder to reason about the code.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.h:
(svn_wc__copy_t.svn_wc__copy_translate_special_only): removed
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c:
(file_xfer_under_path): remove "special_only" argument.
(log_do_file_xfer): don't fetch "special_only" from the XML args, nor
pass the flag to file_xfer_under_path()
(loggy_move_copy_internal): don't take a special_only flag, and don't
put it into the xml output.
(svn_wc__loggy_copy): trim the copy_op[] table, and don't pass a
special_only flag to loggy_move_copy_internal
(svn_wc__loggy_move): remove special_only flag from the call to
loggy_move_copy_internal.

author: gstein
msg: Change svn_wc_copy() over to use the new add_repos_file3() interface. This
gets rid of a number of copies within the function (although they actually
kind of move into add_repos_file3(), but deferring a copy is always
better... one day even that temp copy might be avoided).
We now pass around cancellation and notification funcs/batons, and a small
tweak to the add_repos_file3() definition to use svn_wc_notify_func2_t
(didn't notice that before).
* subversion/include/svn_wc.h:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c:
(svn_wc_add_repos_file3): use svn_wc_notify_func2_t instead
* subversion/libsvn_wc/copy.c:
(copy_file_administratively): take cancellation func/baton to pass off
to add_repos_file3(). just open streams on the files to be copied
rather than access them via their paths, and perform (de)translation
as appropriate on the streams passed to add_repos_file3().
